name: feebly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a weak way, without energy, strength, or power: He lifted his hands feebly. The ball hopped feebly toward the goal.
in a way that is not effective or good: "It's nice!" said Henry feebly. I objected, but only feebly. See
feeble
More examplesFewer examplesI reached the tree and leaned feebly against it.She smiled feebly.They protested feebly that they didn't know what I was talking about.I was feebly trying to make my excuses.
